title: Bill Murray spotted with original Ghostbusters cast near the set of the sequel
text:
Ghostbuster Bill Murray may be about to don his proton pack for a third time - after he was spotted out drinking with co-stars Dan Aykroyd and Sigourney Weaver in Canada, DailyMailTV can reveal.

The Hollywood actor, 69, has remained tight-lipped on whether he would reprise his role as Dr Peter Venkman.

Original cast members Aykroyd, Weaver, Ernie Hudson and Annie Potts have all signed up for the new movie - called Ghostbusters 2020 - directed by Jason Reitman.

Scroll down for video

The originals: Bill Murray has sparked rumors he may be appearing in the new Ghostbusters sequel after he was spotted having drinks with former co-stars Dan Aykroyd and Sigourney Weaver (pictured) in a hotel in Canada

We decided to stay in Calgary over the weekend and as I looked through the window of our hotel’s restaurant— in the attached video you can see Dan Aykroyd, Bill Murray, and Sigourney Weaver (filming a sequel to Ghostbusters). Posted by Jason Ivan Burden on Saturday, 14 September 2019

Earlier this year it was announced Aykroyd will return as Raymond Stance, Ernie Hudson as Winston Zeddmore, and Sigourney Weaver as Dana Barnett - but Murray is yet to officially confirm if he will reprise his role

Thirty-five years later: There have been rumors Murray, who played Dr Peter Venkman in the 1984 blockbuster, will return for a cameo or a small role

Video, obtained by DailyMailTV, shows Murray at a hotel bar in Calgary, Canada, last month with stars of the original 1984 film.

And the grainy footage has now raised fans' hopes he will return.

There have been rumors about Murray coming back for a small cameo, possibly as a ghost.

Murray is yet to officially confirm he will appear in the sequel due out next summer.

In the video filmed by Jason Ivan Burden and posted on his Facebook profile, Murray can be seen raising his glass with Aykroyd, who recently confirmed his return as Raymond Stance.

Speaking on the Joe Rogan Experience, Aykroyd said: 'Ivan Reitman's son Jason has written a new movie, called - well, it's gonna be Ghostbusters, the third movie.

'It'll be all or most of the original people. And then young stars. It's gonna be great.

'I'm so excited about it, and it's just wonderful to be able to go back and revisit that. I don't do the pictures anymore much, and I'm in that one.'

Aykroyd said that the team were 'hoping' Murray would also sign up, while Reitman has previously confirmed the Groundhog Day star has read the script.

I ain't afraid of no ghost: The new film will be the first not to feature Harold Ramis, who played the brains of the group Egon (far right) after he tragically passed in 2014

Ghostbusters 2020 - which will be released next summer - will be directed by Jason Reitman (right) the son of the film's original director, Ivan Reitman (left)

In June, Paul Rudd confirmed he would be joining the cast after tweeting 'look who answered the call.'

He added: 'I can't wait to join the cast this fall for Ghostbusters. In fact I'm sliming myself right now.'

Rudd was also recently quizzed about whether Murray would be in the movie but was tight-lipped.

Comic Murray was recently filmed getting drunk at a student's flat in Fife, Scotland.

Murray — who was in the town for the Alfred Dunhill Links Championship golf — was invited by Hugh Kelly, 26, after he bumped into the actor at a pub.

The Glasgow student said: 'He started drinking with us and we managed to get him back to ours after. He's nearly 70 and he's just there getting hammered with us.'
